result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. TRENT J.D. FORMILLER

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order
Scheduling Order (incorrect year listed)

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant TRENT J.D. FORMILLER in court.  Attorney Kirk William Everson in court for TRENT J.D. FORMILLER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Evers states this matter should be set for jury trial. Court sets for Status Hearing on February 7, 2023 at 1:00 PM and all motions and witness lists to be filed the day before.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant TRENT J.D. FORMILLER in court.  Attorney Kirk William Everson in court for TRENT J.D. FORMILLER.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Everson states there is no agreement at this time. DA Laspisa states an offer was sent back in June. Court sets for Status Hearing on October 25, 2022 at 3:30 PM.
Status hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on September 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-Trial Status Report
J.E.S.
Return date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:26 PM Defendant TRENT J.D. FORMILLER in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kirk William Everson in court for TRENT J.D. FORMILLER. Atty Evers states the prelim will proceed. State has one witness. 

Scott Strahan sworn, direct by DA Laspisa, is employed as a Sergeant of Patrol for City of Berlin Police Department. Was employed on the date in question. venue established, Testimony given. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross exam by Atty Evers. Objection by DA Laspisa. Sustained. Atty Evers continues with cross examination. Objection by DA Laspisa. Court questions Atty Evers. Statement by Atty Evers. Overruled. Atty Evers continues with cross examination. Re-direct by DA Laspisa. Objection by Atty Evers. Sustained. DA Laspisa continues with re-direct. Court questions Atty Evers. Statement by Atty Evers. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that at least one felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court and email to Atty Evers, same as the criminal complaint.. Attorney Evers waives any reading. Atty Evers enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 3:46 PM
Return date scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant TRENT J.D. FORMILLER not in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kirk William Everson in court for TRENT J.D. FORMILLER. Atty Everson requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled. Court sets for Preliminary Hearing on April 26, 2022 at 2:30 PM (!/2 hour)

Note:  defendant appeared via zoom after the Court had already scheduled the preliminary hearing.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns. Defendant is not to possess any firearms and no firearms in the residence.

You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns. Defendant is not to possess any firearms and no firearms in the residence.

10:58 AM Defendant TRENT J.D. FORMILLER appeared in court, Attorney Kirk William Everson appeared in court for TRENT J.D. FORMILLER, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Everson requests to amend the bond to no violent contact. DA Laspisa states the victim is present in the court room today. Victim is present and wishes to address the court. Statement by the victim. DA Laspisa objects to bond modification. Statement by DA Laspisa. Atty Everson would not object to amended conditions. Court converts cash bond remains. NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns. Defendant is not to possess any firearms and no firearms in the residence.

Request to Amend No Contact Order / Verification of Contact / Release of Information and Waiver of Nondisclosure Form
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely

9:33 AM Defendant TRENT J.D. FORMILLER appeared in court, Attorney Kirk William Everson appeared by video for TRENT J.D. FORMILLER, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and Atty Everson waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Victim present via zoom. Statement by the victim . Statement by Atty Everson regarding lifting the no contact with the victim. DA Laspisa objects to bond modification. Statement by the victim. Further statement by Atty Everson regarding bond modification. Court denies bond modification. Court requests the victim go to the Christine Ann Center and submit something in writing. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Preliminary Hearing.

Court adjourned at 9:40 AM

Status of Prelim set for March 23, 2022 at 2:00 PM can be via zoom.

**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Letter to the Court from the victim (JS) dated Feb 13, 2022 re: request to have no contact lifted
**PROCESSING NEEDED**

No Contact with the victim. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer. Defendant is not to possess any firearms.

NOT ON THE RECORD 
Defendant TRENT J.D. FORMILLER appeared in court, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for TRENT J.D. FORMILLER, Attorney Gerise Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement and finds probable cause that a crime may have been committed.  Statement by DA Laspisa - no complaint has been filed yet. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Statement by the defendant. Court orders bond at $500 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer. Defendant is not to possess any firearms.  

Court sets Initial Appearance for Feb 15, 2022 at 9:30 AM.
